content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Automation Science Pack Production Setup at position(x=8.5, y=13.5)
Consists of following entities:
- Assembling machine-1 at position(x=8.5, y=13.5)
- Iron gear input system:
  - Wooden chest at position(x=8.5, y=10.5)
  - Burner inserter at position(x=8.5, y=11.5)
- Copper plate input system:
  - Wooden chest at position(x=6.5, y=14.5)
  - Burner inserter at position(x=6.5, y=13.5)
- Output system:
  - Burner inserter at position(x=10.5, y=13.5)
  - Wooden chest at position(x=11.5, y=13.5)
- Electric pole at position(x=8.5, y=17.5)

### Power Generation System at position(x=-4.5, y=16.0)
Consists of:
- Steam engine at position(x=-4.5, y=12.5)
- Boiler at position(x=-4.5, y=16.0)
- Offshore pump at position(x=-3.5, y=27.5)
- Multiple pipe groups connecting water and steam
- Electricity network with multiple poles

### Mining and Smelting Operations
Multiple mining and smelting setups at various positions including:
- Mining drills at positions (x=41.0, y=-82.0), (x=-28.0, y=-61.0), (x=-18.0, y=-53.0)
- Stone furnaces at positions (x=-25.0, y=-59.0), (x=-15.0, y=-51.0), (x=14.0, y=14.0)
- Associated inserters and chests for input/output

ERROR TIPS

### Errors when placing entities near existing structures
- Check for existing entities (especially transport belts) before placing new entities
- Increase spacing parameter when placing entities if the default spacing results in conflicts
- Consider alternative directions when the desired placement position is blocked

### Power connection issues
- Ensure proper connection between power networks
- Place electric poles with appropriate spacing to avoid conflicts with existing structures
- Verify power supply is working before setting up powered machines

### Resource and ingredient shortages
- Ensure input chests are stocked with required materials
- Verify inserters have fuel and are properly positioned to transfer items
- Check recipe requirements and maintain adequate supply of all ingredients

### Entity placement conflicts
- Plan layout carefully to avoid overlapping entities
- Consider removing conflicting entities before placing new ones
- Use appropriate spacing and direction parameters when placing entities next to each other
